lead_paragraph: LONE--Robert. age 86, passed away peacefully April 28, 2016. He was a Navy Veteran. His wide range of interests led to three successful careers. He was a top dancer, world traveler and art expert. As an actor, singer, and dancer, he appeared in six Broadway musicals, over 100 television shows (Lead Dancer - Ed Sullivan Show), movies and commercials (Aqua Velva Man 1970s). He performed with Carol Lawrence, Cyd Charisse and Ginger Rogers. He worked for the Wally F. Galleries, New York City. As the Designer and Director of Jasper Galleries, Houston, TX, he frequented Europe and America buying paintings and sculptures. He attended Parsons School of Design, became a successful Interior Designer and worked into his 80s. He was born in Minneapolis, MN and moved to New York City in the early 1950s. He will be missed by his family and wide circle of friends. He requested no memorial. Donations: Any art organization of your choice. Visit: www.facebook.com/ RobertMartinLone 1/3
